intro: Nassauvia axillaris var. contracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to red flowers, which bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
